newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * The cabinet of Prime Minister Nicolae Vacaroiu is presenting its activity report for the past four years in office in its weekly session.
The cabinet will also discuss the stage of autumn farming work and the prepartions for Sunday's presidential run-off.
* After two months of campaigning, Romanians have two more days to clarify options for the November 17 run-off.

Sunday's vote will elect one of the two contenders -- President Ion Iliescu of the Party of Social Democracy and Emil Constantinescu of the opposition Democratic Convention -- to be the new president for the following four years.
* Printing of voting ballots and of all papers needed to centralise final results has been completed.
* Accreditations for local and international observers issued for the first election round remain valid for Sunday too.
* President Iliescu's name is printed on the second page of the ballot paper and Constantinescu's name on the third. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
